New Records: Shohei Ohtani tied the game with a single and stole his 56th base of the season.
Michael Kopech earned his 15th save of the season.
Alex Vesia earned his 5th win of the season.
Shohei Ohtani was named the NL Player of the Week for his performance the previous week.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani worked his magic with a single in the go-ahead run and a stolen base.
The Padres tied the game in the ninth inning but couldn't take the lead.
Dodger Stadium fans celebrated a playoff atmosphere as the game ended.
The Dodgers increased their lead over the Padres to three games with four to play.
Pre-Game Insights: The Padres were celebrating making the postseason before the game.
Shohei Ohtani was front and center after being named NL Player of the Week.
The Dodgers struck early in the game.
Blake Treinen mowed down the Padres' lineup 1-2-3 in the eighth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Padres manager Mike Shildt said the team was playing for the division title.
The Dodgers were one win away from clinching the division title.
The Padres had to win the next game to have any chance at the NL West title.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the Padres' five-game winning streak being snapped.
Fernando Tatis Jr. hit the longest home run by a Padre this season.
The Dodgers and Padres both had already clinched postseason berths.
The game's atmosphere was electric at Dodger Stadium.
Others: The game was the 100th meeting between the two teams.
Joe Musgrove and Walker Buehler were the starting pitchers for the finale.
